page.title: 03St. James the Great Church
page.content: It is a fairly small church with a congregation ranging from 16 to 60 depending upon the occasion. There are regular attenders and those who only come on special occasions like Christmas and Easter. There are four different services; Matins, Family Service ( a fun service when the children attend and help out), Holy Communion and Family Communion. There is also a Sunday School for the children. There are two clubs associated with the church. The Tuesday Club is for the younger members and Wreckers for those in the choir. At present the choir comprises ten females. Churchill and Blakedown produce a monthly combined Parish magazine at a cost of 10p. It lists all the services and events that are taking place in the near future.
